clinical_study.brief_title: Trail Evaluating Apatinib With IMRT for Inoperable or Iodine Refractory Thyroid Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy Combined With Apatinib for Inoperable or Iodine Refractory Thyroid Cancer: A Phase II Single-arm Study

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the efficacy and safety of intensity modulated radiation therapy combined with apatinib for inoperable or iodine refractory thyroid cancer.

primary_outcome.description: The time from date of randomization until date of first documented disease progression or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Three months after completion of the therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants responded to the therapy according to RECIST 1.1
Overall survival is calculated from randomization to death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial treatment to first response, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first response to the therapy according to RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first response to disease progression, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the first response to the therapy to disease progression

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by NCI CTCAE v4.03
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time interval from start to 3 months after completion of the therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of acute and late toxicity

arm_group.description: Participants will receive apatinib (0.5g, daily) for two cycles followed by intensity modulated radiation therapy (Primary site and lymph nodes: 66 Gy/33F, metastatic site: 40-60Gy/20-30F)

intervention.description: Apatinib will be used as induction therapy in experimental arm.
Intensity modulated radiation therapy will be used for patients with progression disease during induction therapy or after induction therapy.
